dt.t: The coach {it}chastised{/it} the players for their mistakes.

pt: {sc}punish{/sc} {sc}chastise{/sc} {sc}castigate{/sc} {sc}chasten{/sc} {sc}discipline{/sc} {sc}correct{/sc} mean to inflict a penalty on in requital for wrongdoing. {sc}punish{/sc} implies subjecting to a penalty for wrongdoing.
{sc}chastise{/sc} may apply to either the infliction of corporal punishment or to verbal censure or denunciation.

pt.t: {it}chastised{/it} his son for neglecting his studies

pt: {sc}castigate{/sc} usually implies a severe, typically public censure.

pt.t: an editorial {it}castigating{/it} the entire city council

pt: {sc}chasten{/sc} suggests any affliction or trial that leaves one humbled or subdued.
{sc}discipline{/sc} implies a punishing or chastening in order to bring under control.
{sc}correct{/sc} implies punishing aimed at reforming an offender.

pt.t: the function of prison is to {it}correct{/it} the wrongdoer

shortdef: to inflict punishment on (as by whipping)
